techmeme.title: Margit Wennmachers, who has shaped a16z's marketing approach since joining in 2010, is stepping down and "graduating" from operating partner to partner emeritus (Michael Bodley/PitchBook)
Microsoft became the second company to surpass $4T in market cap, joining Nvidia, after shares jumped 8%+ in after-hours trading on better-than-expected results (CNBC)
China's JD.com launches a takeover bid for German electronics retailer Ceconomy, which operates 1,000+ stores in Europe, valuing Ceconomy's equity at ~€2.2B (Financial Times)
Samsung reports Q1 revenue up 0.7% YoY to $53.7B, vs. $53.6B est., operating profit down 55% YoY to $3.4B, vs. $3.8B est., with chips operating profit down ~94% (Dylan Butts/CNBC)
Meta expects 2025 capital expenditures to be between $66B and $72B, raising the low end of the company's previous estimate of $64B to $72B (Jonathan Vanian/CNBC)
